titleStmt.title: An account of two voyages to New-England wherein you have the setting out of a ship, with the charges, the prices of all necessaries for furnishing a planter and his family at his first coming, a description of the countrey, natives, and creatures, with their merchantil and physical use, the government of the countrey as it is now possessed by the English, &c., a large chronological table of the most remarkable passages, from the first dicovering of the continent of America, to the year 1673 / by John Josselyn, Gent.
titleStmt.author: Josselyn, John, fl. 1630-1675.

titleStmt.title: An account of two voyages to New-England wherein you have the setting out of a ship, with the charges, the prices of all necessaries for furnishing a planter and his family at his first coming, a description of the countrey, natives, and creatures, with their merchantil and physical use, the government of the countrey as it is now possessed by the English, &c., a large chronological table of the most remarkable passages, from the first dicovering of the continent of America, to the year 1673 / by John Josselyn, Gent.
titleStmt.author: Josselyn, John, fl. 1630-1675.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
"Chronological observations of America, from the year of the world to the year of Christ, 1673" (p. [217]-279 [i.e. 277]) has special t.p.
